meanings.definition: The non-physical part of a person which is the seat of emotions and character.
meanings.sent1: Her kind spirit always shines through in her actions.
meanings.sent2: His spirit lifted when he heard the good news.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous spirit of the child led to some playful pranks.
meanings.sent4: The spirit of unity brought the community together in times of need.
meanings.sent5: The spirit of determination in her eyes was evident to all who met her.

meanings.sent1: His cheerful spirit brightened up the room.
meanings.sent2: She had a competitive spirit that drove her to succeed.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous spirit in him made him try skydiving for the first time.
meanings.sent4: The spirit of cooperation among team members led to a successful project.
meanings.sent5: The spirit of generosity in her actions touched many hearts.

meanings.sent1: He ordered a shot of his favorite spirit at the bar.
meanings.sent2: The bartender mixed the cocktail with premium spirit.
meanings.sent3: The potent spirit in the drink warmed him up on a cold night.
meanings.sent4: The smooth spirit went down easily, leaving a warm sensation.
meanings.sent5: The rich aroma of the spirit filled the room, enticing patrons.

meanings.sent1: Legends speak of a mischievous spirit haunting the old mansion.
meanings.sent2: The ancient forest was said to be home to mystical spirits.
meanings.sent3: The friendly spirit in the ghost made it less frightening to the children.
meanings.sent4: The spirit of nature whispered through the wind in the enchanted forest.
meanings.sent5: The ethereal spirit glowed softly, illuminating the dark cave.
